title.rendered: Financial Commission Continues To Educate Traders on Risks of Options Trading

content.rendered:
May 16th, 2019, The Financial Commission today announces the publication of an additional educational article on options trading in a Tips For All section of the organization’s official website. The article focuses on important characteristics of binary options, including short-term expirations, the bid-ask spread and how to minimize risks when trading such financial products.

All interested traders can now access the article and find out more details on short-term options trading from Dispute Resolution Committee members Demetrios Zamboglou and Roland Gemayel.

The Financial Commission regularly publishes tips for traders, as well as articles designed to educate traders on making informed decisions when trading or investing in the market. The latest published article is the second in a series dedicated specifically to binary options to help traders understand the key differences between Forex and options contracts.

About Financial Commission

Founded in 2013, the Financial Commission is a leading independent member-driven external dispute resolution (EDR) organization for international online brokerages that participate in global foreign exchange (forex), derivatives, and CFD markets.

Financial Commission provides efficient compliance solutions to its members, alongside its External Dispute Resolution (EDR) mechanism that serves as an effective channel for processing complaints from clients of member firms.

To find out how the Commission is increasing traders education and market awareness, please visit the Traders section of our website.
